intro: Randia africana, commonly known as African randia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Randia africana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
